meanings.definition: A type of dance move where one spins around on one foot.
meanings.sent1: During the dance competition, Sarah performed a perfect louie.
meanings.sent2: The dance instructor taught the students how to do a proper louie.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Mark attempted a louie but ended up bumping into the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful movements on the dance floor resembled a spinning louie.
meanings.sent5: The spinning louie move added an exciting flair to the routine.

meanings.definition: A type of coin used in France.
meanings.sent1: In his collection, John had a rare louie from the 1800s.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed ancient artifacts, including French louies.
meanings.sent3: Tom found a shiny louie on the sidewalk and thought he was lucky.
meanings.sent4: The old louie gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting its history.
meanings.sent5: The louie was a valuable addition to the numismatic exhibit.

meanings.definition: A type of knot used in sailing.
meanings.sent1: The sailor expertly tied a secure louie to fasten the sail.
meanings.sent2: During the sailing lesson, the instructor demonstrated how to tie a louie.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, Alex tied a louie on his friend's backpack, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The louie held the ropes tightly together, ensuring safe navigation.
meanings.sent5: The intricate louie knot was essential for securing the boat.
